name: imgui
description: Dear ImGui: Bloat-free Graphical User interface for C++ with minimal dependencies
readme_summary: Dear ImGui is a bloat-free C++ graphical user interface library designed for rapid development of tools and visualizations. It prioritizes simplicity, portability, and efficiency, making it suitable for integration into game engines, real-time applications, and embedded systems. It empowers programmers to create dynamic UIs with minimal dependencies.
key_features: Bloat-free graphical user interface library for C++
Easy to use for dynamic UI creation
primary_use_case: Creating content creation tools, visualization tools, and debug tools within game engines, real-time 3D applications, and embedded systems.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan meticulously crafting intricate clockwork mechanisms within a grand clock tower. Each gear and spring represents a UI element, fitting perfectly to create a seamless interface. The artisan uses a C++ toolkit, subtly visible on their workbench, to fine-tune the components. A large window reveals a cityscape where the clock's precise timekeeping powers various applications. Digital particles subtly highlight the flow of data within the clockwork. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light. The image should be in a detailed 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear lines.

name: data-engineer-handbook
description: This is a repo with links to everything you'd ever want to learn about data engineering
readme_summary: This repository serves as a handbook for data engineers, offering a curated collection of resources, including roadmaps, projects, interview advice, books, and communities. It aims to provide a comprehensive guide for individuals looking to learn about or advance their careers in data engineering by providing links to external resources.
key_features: Roadmap for breaking into data engineering
Curated list of data engineering projects
Collection of resources for interview preparation
List of high-quality data engineering books
Comprehensive list of companies and tools in the data engineering landscape
primary_use_case: Providing a comprehensive collection of resources for learning and navigating the field of data engineering.
cover_image_prompt: A master librarian, surrounded by towering shelves overflowing with books, scrolls, and digital tablets, meticulously organizes and connects them all with glowing threads of data. Each resource represents a different aspect of data engineering, from big data to SQL. The librarian holds a magnifying glass, focusing on a central holographic display showcasing a roadmap of data engineering knowledge. Subtle UI elements float around the scene, displaying links and topics from the repository. The scene is set in a grand, futuristic library with soft, illuminating light. The image should be in a detailed 3D isometric illustration style with a warm color scheme.

name: ratatui
description: A Rust crate for cooking up terminal user interfaces (TUIs) üë®‚Äçüç≥üêÄ https://ratatui.rs
readme_summary: Ratatui is a Rust crate that provides a flexible and simple way to build terminal user interfaces (TUIs). It offers a collection of widgets and layout components to create interactive console applications, dashboards, and other terminal-based programs. Ratatui also provides templates to help developers quickly get started with new projects.
primary_use_case: Creating interactive command-line applications and dashboards with terminal-based user interfaces.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled chef, a rat wearing a tiny chef's hat, meticulously crafting a complex dish using ingredients represented by code snippets and UI elements. The kitchen is a stylized terminal window, with the dish being a beautifully rendered TUI on a screen. The chef carefully arranges widgets and layouts, represented by colorful ingredients, on a plate. Subtle digital particles float around, enhancing the visual connection to software. The scene is brightly lit with a focus on the chef's precision. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details.

name: scitopdf
description: Quickly fetch and pop scientific papers.
readme_summary: SciToPDF is a shell script designed to simplify the process of obtaining scientific papers. It leverages multiple search engines and databases, accepting various forms of input to locate and download papers. The script offers a range of command-line options for customization, including batch downloading and directory management.
key_features: Fetches scientific papers using various search engines and databases (Crossref, Sci-Hub, Libgen).
Accepts various inputs like DOI, URL, title, authors, etc.
Offers command-line options for customization (download directory, quiet mode, etc.).
Supports batch downloading from bibliography files.
Provides options for setting Sci-Hub address and DNS.
primary_use_case: Quickly fetching and downloading scientific papers from the command line.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian, surrounded by towering stacks of books, uses a magical magnifying glass to instantly transform scattered book fragments into perfectly bound scientific papers. The magnifying glass emits a beam of light that pulls information from distant sources, visualized as glowing data streams, and assembles them into complete PDFs. Subtle UI elements float around the librarian, displaying search queries and download progress. The scene is set in a grand, sunlit library with a warm, inviting atmosphere. The image should be in a detailed digital painting style with clear outlines and vibrant colors.

name: audiobookshelf
readme_summary: Audiobookshelf is a self-hosted server for managing and streaming audiobooks and podcasts. It offers features such as multi-user support, progress syncing, automatic library updates, and metadata management. It also supports ebook formats and provides an API for building custom tools.
primary_use_case: Self-hosting an audiobook and podcast server for personal or multi-user use.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a cozy library where books float gently from shelves to a central, glowing orb. This orb represents Audiobookshelf, seamlessly organizing and streaming audiobooks and podcasts. A diverse group of listeners, each with their own device (phone, tablet, laptop), are connected to the orb via glowing threads, representing streaming. Subtle UI elements float around the orb, showing playback controls and library organization. The library is bathed in warm, inviting light, creating a sense of comfort and accessibility. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with soft colors and a focus on clarity and user-friendliness.

name: videoseal
readme_summary: The VideoSeal repository provides an open and efficient solution for video watermarking. It includes pre-trained models, training and inference code, and evaluation tools. The repository also offers baselines of state-of-the-art image watermarking models adapted for video, enabling users to easily embed and detect watermarks in video content.
key_features: Baselines of state-of-the-art image watermarking models adapted for video watermarking (MBRS, CIN, TrustMark, and WAM)
primary_use_case: Open and efficient video watermarking for protecting video content.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled artisan meticulously embedding shimmering, digital threads into a pristine tapestry, representing a video. The artisan uses a specialized loom that subtly displays lines of code and data visualizations. Once embedded, the threads become invisible to the naked eye, yet remain detectable by a unique lens held by a quality inspector. The scene is set in a bright, modern workshop with a focus on precision and artistry. The repository name, 'VideoSeal,' is subtly etched into the loom. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.

name: browservice
description: Browservice: Browse the modern web on historical browsers
readme_summary: Browservice is a web proxy server that allows users to browse modern websites on historical browsers. It achieves this by rendering the browser viewport into images and displaying them on the client browser using a JavaScript application. The project provides up-to-date builds with the latest Chromium versions and offers various command-line options for customization and control.
key_features: Enables browsing the modern web on historical browsers
Uses JavaScript application on the client browser to display images
Supports command line arguments for customization (e.g., certificate exceptions, control bar visibility, initial zoom, font rendering)
Provides binaries for patched CEF distribution for easier modification
Supports soft navigation buttons and partial blocking of local file access
Supports running the proxy server on Windows
primary_use_case: Browsing modern websites on older, historical web browsers by acting as a proxy server that renders the content into images.
cover_image_prompt: An archaeologist carefully brushing dust off an ancient computer terminal, revealing a modern webpage displayed on its screen. The archaeologist holds a magnifying glass, examining the webpage with curiosity. Faint digital particles emanate from the screen, highlighting the connection between the old hardware and the new content. The scene is set in a dimly lit museum exhibit with artifacts surrounding the terminal. A small plaque on the terminal reads 'Browservice'. The composition is focused and clean, with a warm color scheme. The image should be in a detailed digital painting style with clear outlines and a sense of historical discovery.

name: keep-alive
description: Keep-Alive is a lightweight, cross-platform utility to prevent your system from sleeping. Perfect for uninterrupted downloads, active connections, or long-running tasks.
readme_summary: Keep-Alive is a lightweight, cross-platform utility designed to prevent systems from going to sleep. It supports macOS, Windows, and Linux, offering configurable keep-alive durations and a simple, intuitive interface. The tool is ideal for maintaining active connections, ensuring uninterrupted downloads, and supporting long-running tasks.
primary_use_case: Preventing system sleep for uninterrupted downloads, active connections, or long-running tasks.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent groundskeeper tending to a server farm represented as a lush garden. The groundskeeper carefully prunes overgrown processes (represented as vines) and ensures that each server (plant) receives the right amount of 'energy' to prevent it from going dormant. Small digital displays embedded in the plants show uptime metrics and process activity. The scene is set in a vibrant, futuristic greenhouse with soft, diffused lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and a bright, optimistic color scheme.
